lead_paragraph: Marion, Ala., is in the throes of a tuberculosis outbreak so severe that it has posted an incidence rate that is about 100 times greater than the state’s and worse than many developing countries.
snippet: Marion, Ala., is in the throes of a tuberculosis outbreak so severe that it has posted an incidence rate that is about 100 times greater than the state’s and worse than many developing countries.

headline.main: In Rural Alabama, a Longtime Mistrust of Medicine Fuels a Tuberculosis Outbreak
headline.print_headline: Outbreak Is Fueled by Mistrust in Alabama

abstract: Tuberculosis outbreak in rural town of Marion, Ala, has incidence rate about 100 times higher than rest of state; is attributed to area's history of limited medical access, poverty and mistrust of public health programs; residents are offered financial incentives to undergo testing and treatment.
